description:
Various: Drop expansion of RCS identifiers in two modules.

I'm sure I'm the only simultaneous user of HG and CVS, but the
change is entirely benign.  The problem is that these two files
continue to appear as "changed" to a CVS repository.  Freezing
the identification tags unexpanded simplifies mechanisation in
this environment.

I won't be bothered if the submission is rejected, but please
remove this paragraph before committing this.

messages.text:
Hello golang-dev@googlegroups.com (cc: golang-dev@googlegroups.com, rsc@golang.org),

I'd like you to review this change to
https://go.googlecode.com/hg/

No thanks.  Both of these files are from external sources
and I want to keep them as they are.

I suggest using svn if you are looking for a version
control system that is more like cvs than hg.
Svn lets you turn off RCS keyword expansion
(and in fact I think it is off by default).

Russ

CVS does that, but the stored version continues to differ from the
released one.  As I say, it is a small irritant, not a serious
failing.  Your rationale is perfectly sufficient.

Lucio.

On 11/28/11, Russ Cox <rsc@golang.org> wrote:
> No thanks.  Both of these files are from external sources
> and I want to keep them as they are.
>
> I suggest using svn if you are looking for a version
> control system that is more like cvs than hg.
> Svn lets you turn off RCS keyword expansion
> (and in fact I think it is off by default).
>
> Russ
>

subject: code review 5433052: Various: Drop expansion of RCS identifiers in two modules.
